name: DialogComponent
desc: Text dialog (speech bubble)

name: DialogComponent
desc:
The dialogSize dictates the maximum width and height of the
dialog box.

name: absoluteAngle
desc:
The resulting angle after all the ancestors and the components own angle
has been applied.

name: absoluteCenter
desc: The absolute center of the component.

name: absolutePosition
desc: The anchor's position in absolute (world) coordinates.

name: absolutePositionOf
desc:
Convert local coordinates of a point point inside the component
into the global (world) coordinate space.

name: absolutePositionOfAnchor
desc:
Similar to absolutePositionOf(), but applies to any anchor
point within the component.

name: absoluteScale
desc:
The resulting scale after all the ancestors and the components own scale
has been applied.

name: absoluteScaledSize
desc:
The resulting size after all the ancestors and the components own scale
has been applied.

name: absoluteToLocal
desc:
Transform point from the global (world) coordinate space into the
local coordinates. This function is the inverse of
absolutePositionOf().

name: absoluteTopLeftPosition
desc: The absolute top left position regardless of whether it is a child or not.

name: add
desc: Schedules component to be added as a child to this component.

name: addAll
desc: A convenience method to add multiple children at once.

name: addToParent
desc: Adds this component as a child of parent (see add for details).

name: ancestors
desc:
An iterator producing this component's parent, then its parent's parent,
then the great-grand-parent, and so on, until it reaches a component
without a parent.

name: anchor
desc:
Anchor point for this component. An anchor point describes a point
within the rectangle of size size. This point is considered to
be the logical "center" of the component. This can be visualized
as the point where Flame "grabs" the component. All transforms
occur around this point: the position is where the anchor point
will end up after the component is translated; the rotation and
scaling also happen around this anchor point.

name: angle
desc:
Rotation angle (in radians) of the component. The component will be
rotated around its anchor point in the clockwise direction if the
angle is positive, or counterclockwise if the angle is negative.

name: angleTo
desc:
Returns the angle formed by component's orientation vector and a vector
starting at component's absolute position and ending at target. This
angle is measured in clockwise direction. target should be in absolute/world
coordinate system.

name: center
desc:
The position of the center of the component's bounding rectangle
in the parent's coordinates.

name: children
desc: The children components of this component.

name: componentsAtLocation
desc:
This is a generic implementation of componentsAtPoint; refer to those
docs for context.

name: componentsAtPoint
desc:
An iterable of descendant components intersecting the given point. The
point is in the local coordinate space.

name: contains
desc: Whether the children list contains the given component.

name: containsLocalPoint
desc:
Test whether the point (given in local coordinates) lies within this
component. The top and the left borders of the component are inclusive,
while the bottom and the right borders are exclusive.

name: containsPoint
desc:
Test whether the point (given in global coordinates) lies within this
component. The top and the left borders of the component are inclusive,
while the bottom and the right borders are exclusive.

name: createComponentSet
desc:
This method creates the children container for the current component.
Override this method if you need to have a custom ComponentSet within
a particular class.

name: debugColor
desc: The color that the debug output should be rendered with.

name: debugCoordinatesPrecision
desc:
How many decimal digits to print when displaying coordinates in the
debug mode. Setting this to null will suppress all coordinates from
the output.

name: debugMode
desc:
Returns whether this Component is in debug mode or not.
When a child is added to the Component it gets the same debugMode as
its parent has when it is prepared.

name: debugPaint
desc: The debugColor represented as a Paint object.

name: debugTextPaint
desc:
Returns a TextPaint object with the debugColor set as color for the
text.

name: decorator
desc: The decorator is used to apply visual effects to a component.

name: descendants
desc: Recursively enumerates all nested children.

name: dialogueRunner
desc:
The owner of this DialogueView. This property will be null when the
dialogue view hasn't been attached to any DialogueRunner yet.

name: distance
desc:
Measure the distance (in parent's coordinate space) between this
component's anchor and the other component's anchor.

name: findGame
desc: Fetches the nearest FlameGame ancestor to the component.

name: findParent
desc:
Returns the closest parent further up the hierarchy that satisfies type=T,
or null if no such parent can be found.

name: findRootGame
desc: Fetches the root FlameGame ancestor to the component.

name: firstChild
desc:
Returns the first child that matches the given type T, or null if there
are no such children.

name: flipHorizontally
desc: Flip the component horizontally around its anchor point.

name: flipHorizontallyAroundCenter
desc: Flip the component horizontally around its center line.

name: flipVertically
desc: Flip the component vertically around its anchor point.

name: flipVerticallyAroundCenter
desc: Flip the component vertically around its center line.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: height
desc:
The height of the component in local coordinates. Note that the object
may visually appear larger or smaller due to application of scale.

name: isFlippedHorizontally
desc: Whether it is currently flipped horizontally.

name: isFlippedVertically
desc: Whether it is currently flipped vertically.

name: isHovered
desc: Returns true while the component is being dragged.

name: isLoaded
desc: Whether this component has completed its onLoad step.

name: isLoading
desc: Whether the component is currently executing its onLoad step.

name: isMounted
desc: Whether this component is currently added to a component tree.

name: isRemoved
desc:
Whether the component has been removed. Originally this flag is false,
but it becomes true after the component was mounted and then removed
from its parent. The flag becomes false again when the component is
mounted to a new parent.

name: isRemoving
desc: Whether the component is scheduled to be removed.

name: key
desc: A key that can be used to identify this component in the tree.

name: lastChild
desc:
Returns the last child that matches the given type T, or null if there
are no such children.

name: loaded
desc: A future that completes when this component finishes loading.

name: lookAt
desc: Rotates/snaps the component to look at the target.

name: mounted
desc: A future that will complete once the component is mounted on its parent.

name: nativeAngle
desc:
The angle where this component is looking at when it is in
the default state, i.e. when angle is equal to zero.
For example, a nativeAngle of
    0 implies up/north direction
 pi/2 implies right/east direction
   pi implies down/south direction
-pi/2 implies left/west direction

name: noSuchMethod
desc: Invoked when a nonexistent method or property is accessed.

name: onChildrenChanged
desc:
This method will be invoked from lifecycle if child has been added
to or removed from its parent children list.

name: onChoiceFinish
desc: Called when the choice has been made, and the option was selected.

name: onChoiceStart
desc:
Called when the dialogue arrives at an option set, and the player must now
make a choice on how to proceed. If a dialogue view presents this choice
to the player and allows them to make a selection, then it must return a
future that completes when the choice is made. If the dialogue view does
not display menu choice, then it should return null (possibly in a
Future).

name: onCommand
desc: Called when the dialogue encounters a [user-defined command].

name: onDialogueFinish
desc: Called when the dialogue has ended.

name: onDialogueStart
desc:
Called before the start of a new dialogue, i.e. before any lines, options,
or commands are delivered.

name: onFindCharacterPosition
desc:
Called by the dialog to locate a character in the scene
so that the bubble can be positioned correctly.

name: onFinish
desc: Called by the dialog when a dialog session ends.

name: onGameResize
desc: Called whenever the size of the top-level Canvas changes.

name: onLineFinish
desc: Called when the line has finished presenting in all dialogue views.

name: onLineSignal
desc: Called when the dialogue runner sends a signal to all dialogue views.

name: onLineStart
desc: Called when the next dialogue line should be presented to the user.

name: onLineStop
desc:
Called when the game demands that the line finished presenting as soon
as possible.

name: onLoad
desc: Late initialization method for Component.

name: onMount
desc: Called when the component is added to its parent.

name: onNodeFinish
desc: Called when the dialogue exits the node.

name: onNodeStart
desc: Called when the dialogue enters a new node.

name: onParentResize
desc:
Called whenever the parent of this component changes size; and also once
before onMount.

name: onRemove
desc: Called right before the component is removed from the game.

name: onStart
desc: Called by the dialog when a dialog session starts.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: parent
desc: Who owns this component in the component tree.

name: position
desc: The position of this component's anchor on the screen.

name: positionOf
desc:
Convert local coordinates of a point point inside the component
into the parent's coordinate space.

name: positionOfAnchor
desc:
Similar to positionOf(), but applies to any anchor point within
the component.

name: priority
desc:
Render priority of this component. This allows you to control the order in
which your components are rendered.

name: propagateToChildren
desc:
This method first calls the passed handler on the leaves in the tree,
the children without any children of their own.
Then it continues through all other children. The propagation continues
until the handler returns false, which means "do not continue", or when
the handler has been called with all children.

name: remove
desc: Removes a component from the component tree.

name: removeAll
desc:
Removes all the children in the list and calls onRemove for all of them
and their children.

name: removeFromParent
desc: Remove the component from its parent in the next tick.

name: removeWhere
desc: Removes all the children for which the test function returns true.

name: removed
desc: A future that completes when this component is removed from its parent.

name: runtimeType
desc: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

name: scale
desc:
The scale factor of this component. The scale can be different along
the X and Y dimensions. A scale greater than 1 makes the component
bigger, and less than 1 smaller. The scale can also be negative,
which results in a mirror reflection along the corresponding axis.

name: scaledSize
desc:
The "physical" size of the component. This is the size of the
component as seen from the parent's perspective, and it is equal to
size * scale. This is a computed property and cannot be
modified by the user.

name: setByRect
desc:
Mutates position and size using the provided rect as basis.
This is a relative rect, same definition that toRect use
(therefore both methods are compatible,
i.e. setByRect ∘ toRect = identity).

name: setLoaded
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the loaded state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: setMounted
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the mounted state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: setRemoved
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the removed state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: size
desc:
The logical size of the component. The game assumes that this is the
approximate size of the object that will be drawn on the screen.
This size will therefore be used for collision detection and tap
handling.

name: toAbsoluteRect
desc: The bounding rectangle of the component in global coordinate space.

name: toLocal
desc:
Transform point from the parent's coordinate space into the local
coordinates. This function is the inverse of positionOf().

name: toRect
desc: Returns the bounding rectangle for this component.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: topLeftPosition
desc: The top-left corner's position in the parent's coordinates.

name: transformMatrix
desc:
The total transformation matrix for the component. This matrix combines
translation, rotation and scale transforms into a single entity. The
matrix is cached and gets recalculated only as necessary.

name: update
desc:
This method is called periodically by the game engine to request that your
component updates itself.

name: updateTree
desc:
This method traverses the component tree and calls update on all its
children according to their priority order, relative to the
priority of the direct siblings, not the children or the ancestors.

name: width
desc:
The width of the component in local coordinates. Note that the object
may visually appear larger or smaller due to application of scale.

name: x
desc: X position of this component's anchor on the screen.

name: y
desc: Y position of this component's anchor on the screen.

name: DialogOptions
desc: Options available to the speech bubble

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: noSuchMethod
desc: Invoked when a nonexistent method or property is accessed.

name: operator ==
desc: The equality operator.

name: runtimeType
desc: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

desc: A string representation of this object.

desc: A dialog style definition

name: anchor
desc:
Anchor point for this component. An anchor point describes a point
within the rectangle of size size. This point is considered to
be the logical "center" of the component. This can be visualized
as the point where Flame "grabs" the component. All transforms
occur around this point: the position is where the anchor point
will end up after the component is translated; the rotation and
scaling also happen around this anchor point.

name: angle
desc:
Rotation angle (in radians) of the component. The component will be
rotated around its anchor point in the clockwise direction if the
angle is positive, or counterclockwise if the angle is negative.

name: angleTo
desc:
Returns the angle formed by component's orientation vector and a vector
starting at component's absolute position and ending at target. This
angle is measured in clockwise direction. target should be in absolute/world
coordinate system.

name: angularAcceleration
desc: The angular acceleration in radians per second squared

name: angularVelocity
desc: The angular velocity in radians per second

name: angularVelocityRange
desc: The min and max limits of angular velocity

name: center
desc:
The position of the center of the component's bounding rectangle
in the parent's coordinates.

name: children
desc: The children components of this component.

name: componentsAtLocation
desc:
This is a generic implementation of componentsAtPoint; refer to those
docs for context.

name: componentsAtPoint
desc:
An iterable of descendant components intersecting the given point. The
point is in the local coordinate space.

name: contains
desc: Whether the children list contains the given component.

name: containsLocalPoint
desc:
Test whether the point (given in local coordinates) lies within this
component. The top and the left borders of the component are inclusive,
while the bottom and the right borders are exclusive.

name: containsPoint
desc:
Test whether the point (given in global coordinates) lies within this
component. The top and the left borders of the component are inclusive,
while the bottom and the right borders are exclusive.

name: createComponentSet
desc:
This method creates the children container for the current component.
Override this method if you need to have a custom ComponentSet within
a particular class.

name: debugColor
desc: The color that the debug output should be rendered with.

name: debugCoordinatesPrecision
desc:
How many decimal digits to print when displaying coordinates in the
debug mode. Setting this to null will suppress all coordinates from
the output.

name: debugMode
desc:
Returns whether this Component is in debug mode or not.
When a child is added to the Component it gets the same debugMode as
its parent has when it is prepared.

name: debugPaint
desc: The debugColor represented as a Paint object.

name: debugTextPaint
desc:
Returns a TextPaint object with the debugColor set as color for the
text.

name: decorator
desc: The decorator is used to apply visual effects to a component.

name: descendants
desc: Recursively enumerates all nested children.

name: distance
desc:
Measure the distance (in parent's coordinate space) between this
component's anchor and the other component's anchor.

name: findGame
desc: Fetches the nearest FlameGame ancestor to the component.

name: findParent
desc:
Returns the closest parent further up the hierarchy that satisfies type=T,
or null if no such parent can be found.

name: findRootGame
desc: Fetches the root FlameGame ancestor to the component.

name: firstChild
desc:
Returns the first child that matches the given type T, or null if there
are no such children.

name: flipHorizontally
desc: Flip the component horizontally around its anchor point.

name: flipHorizontallyAroundCenter
desc: Flip the component horizontally around its center line.

name: flipVertically
desc: Flip the component vertically around its anchor point.

name: flipVerticallyAroundCenter
desc: Flip the component vertically around its center line.

name: hasCollided
desc:
Implement this method to check if the next position will collide with
something. If it does collide, process the collision (for example, this
object may be destroyed, or it may change direction, or it may bounce).
Return true to set the new position to nextPosition. nextPosition may
be modified to change the new position.

name: hashCode
desc: The hash code for this object.

name: height
desc:
The height of the component in local coordinates. Note that the object
may visually appear larger or smaller due to application of scale.

name: isFlippedHorizontally
desc: Whether it is currently flipped horizontally.

name: isFlippedVertically
desc: Whether it is currently flipped vertically.

name: isLoaded
desc: Whether this component has completed its onLoad step.

name: isLoading
desc: Whether the component is currently executing its onLoad step.

name: isMounted
desc: Whether this component is currently added to a component tree.

name: isRemoved
desc:
Whether the component has been removed. Originally this flag is false,
but it becomes true after the component was mounted and then removed
from its parent. The flag becomes false again when the component is
mounted to a new parent.

name: isRemoving
desc: Whether the component is scheduled to be removed.

name: key
desc: A key that can be used to identify this component in the tree.

name: lastChild
desc:
Returns the last child that matches the given type T, or null if there
are no such children.

name: loaded
desc: A future that completes when this component finishes loading.

name: lookAt
desc: Rotates/snaps the component to look at the target.

name: mounted
desc: A future that will complete once the component is mounted on its parent.

name: nativeAngle
desc:
The angle where this component is looking at when it is in
the default state, i.e. when angle is equal to zero.
For example, a nativeAngle of
    0 implies up/north direction
 pi/2 implies right/east direction
   pi implies down/south direction
-pi/2 implies left/west direction

name: noSuchMethod
desc: Invoked when a nonexistent method or property is accessed.

name: onChildrenChanged
desc:
This method will be invoked from lifecycle if child has been added

name: onGameResize
desc: Called whenever the size of the top-level Canvas changes.

name: onLoad
desc: Late initialization method for Component.

name: onMount
desc: Called when the component is added to its parent.

name: onParentResize

name: onRemove

name: operator ==

name: positionOfAnchor
desc:
Similar to positionOf(), but applies to any anchor point within

name: priority
desc:
Render priority of this component. This allows you to control the order in
which your components are rendered.

name: propagateToChildren
desc:
This method first calls the passed handler on the leaves in the tree,
the children without any children of their own.
Then it continues through all other children. The propagation continues
until the handler returns false, which means "do not continue", or when
the handler has been called with all children.

name: reflect
desc: Bounce this component off a surface with the given normal angle.

name: remove

name: removeFromParent

name: removeWhere
desc: Removes all the children for which the test function returns true.

name: removed
desc: A future that completes when this component is removed from its parent.

name: rotationAcceleration
desc: The rotation acceleration in radians per second squared

name: rotationVelocity
desc: The rotation velocity in radians per second

name: rotationVelocityRange
desc: The min and max limits of rotation velocity

name: runtimeType
desc: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

name: scale
desc:
The scale factor of this component. The scale can be different along
the X and Y dimensions. A scale greater than 1 makes the component
bigger, and less than 1 smaller. The scale can also be negative,
which results in a mirror reflection along the corresponding axis.

name: scaledSize
desc:
The "physical" size of the component. This is the size of the
component as seen from the parent's perspective, and it is equal to
size * scale. This is a computed property and cannot be
modified by the user.

name: setByRect
desc:
Mutates position and size using the provided rect as basis.
This is a relative rect, same definition that toRect use
(therefore both methods are compatible,
i.e. setByRect ∘ toRect = identity).

name: setLoaded
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the loaded state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: setMounted
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the mounted state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: setRemoved
desc:
Used by the FlameGame to set the removed state of the component, since
the game isn't going through the whole normal component life cycle.

name: size
desc:
The logical size of the component. The game assumes that this is the
approximate size of the object that will be drawn on the screen.
This size will therefore be used for collision detection and tap
handling.

name: toAbsoluteRect
desc: The bounding rectangle of the component in global coordinate space.

name: toLocal
desc:
Transform point from the parent's coordinate space into the local
coordinates. This function is the inverse of positionOf().

name: toRect
desc: Returns the bounding rectangle for this component.

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: topLeftPosition
desc: The top-left corner's position in the parent's coordinates.

name: transformMatrix
desc:
The total transformation matrix for the component. This matrix combines
translation, rotation and scale transforms into a single entity. The
matrix is cached and gets recalculated only as necessary.

name: update
desc:
Update the position of this component based on the velocity and
acceleration. hasCollided should be implemented to check if the next
position will collide with something. The position will only be updated
if the next position does not collide.

name: updateTree
desc:
This method traverses the component tree and calls update on all its
children according to their priority order, relative to the
priority of the direct siblings, not the children or the ancestors.

name: velocity
desc: The velocity in pixels per second

name: velocityRange
desc: The min and max limits of velocity

name: PlyAnimProps
desc:
Settings for an animation to play. Provide at least the name of the animation. You can override specific settings
for the animation. Set direction to change the animation direction (see PlyDirection), set repeats to
change the number of times the animation loops, and set speed to change the animation playback speed by a factor.
For example, speed = 1.0 is default, speed = 0.9 plays it at 90% of the original speed, and speed = 0.5 will
play it at half speed.
